name: wind power plant construction, 2MW, offshore, fixed parts | wind power plant, 2MW, offshore, fixed parts | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/6829/documentation

This dataset represents the fixed parts of a 2 MW offshore wind power plant, based on the dimensions of an offshore wind power plant of the type Bonus 2 MW.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From pasture land forseen for the construction of a wind power plant.

This activity ends with the fixed parts of a constructed wind power plant, having a lifetime of 20 years. The dataset includes apart the materials for fixed parts of a wind power plant also the construction efforts and the land use. It is assumed that only the steel tower is disposed off after use. All other materials from the foundation and the network connection are assumed to be left in the ocean.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Technical details of the modeled 2 MW offshore wind power plant;References:;Stiesdal H. (2001) Middelgrunden Offshore. A newsletter for customers and business associates, Bonus energy A/S. General technical description, Technical specification, Drawings and design, Bonus 2 MW offshore. Isager/Bogtryt/Offset, Svendborg, Denmark. www.bonus.dk
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data are from a plant of the type Bonus 2 MW, installed at the wind farm Middelgrunden on the coast of Denmark.

exchanges.description:
Modeled, based on "wind power plant, 2MW, offshore" - pdf-document on the dedicated talk page of ecoinvent (www.ecoinvent.org/documentation). Includes details for the fixed parts (tower, fundament, network connection) of the 2MW offshore wind power plant.
EcoSpold01Location=OCE

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Estimation. The share of reinforcing steel is estimated by (Schleisner, 1999). No waste treatment is modelled as it is assumed that the foundation of the wind power plant will remain in the ocean after use.

Further references:
Schleisner (1999): Life cycle assessment of a wind farm and related externalities. Riso National Laboratory, Roskilde, Denmark.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Estimation. For the tower the most common welding process (MAG-C-process) is assumed. Welding is accounted at a length of 3.8 m height of the tower. The expenses for material consumption are estimated with a weld of 0.166 kg/m and is rounded up generously. A total of 228 m of welding seam in different forms and strenghts are estimated.

exchanges.description:
Estimation. The tower of the plant consists of 98'400 kg of steel. Additionally 15% are estimated for components and service platforms (14'760 kg). 50 kg of steel are used for welding. For the network connection 8766 kg of low-allowed steel are assumed for the sheath of the cable.
EcoSpold01Location=RER

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=GLO
Calculated value. The whole mass of the fundament (2000 t) is lifted 15 m (5 m up and down each, 5 m as an equivalent for horizontal movement), the plant (247'710 kg without network connection) is lifted 60 m. An efficiency factor of 20% is assumed for the crane. For the electricity consumption the formula of potential energy is used.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Calculated value. As a filler for the submarine cable PVC is assumed. In(Schleisner, 1999) PEX is assumed instead. The mass per meter is proportional to the installed power (40 MW/5 MW) and multiplied by 8.

Further references:
Schleisner (1999): Life cycle assessment of a wind farm and related externalities. Riso National Laboratory, Roskilde, Denmark.

flow.name: Occupation, seabed, infrastructure
flow.category: Elementary flows/Resource/land

exchanges.description:
Estimation. The individual offshore wind turbines are connected to a central point. The distance between each plant is 180m. A cable length of 200m is assumed (conductor cross-section 3150 mm2). The share on the cable which leads to the mainland is 175 m for each plant. Additionally the power line is considered within the tower with 60 m (conductor cross-section 31'500 mm2). For the power line in the tower extrapolations are made. It is assumed that the cable in the tower needs less protection against external influences than the submarine cable. For the plant an effective cable length of 435 m is assumed (200 m + 175 m + 60 m) and the mass of copper is 3900 kg.
EcoSpold01Location=RER
